Very poignant, cleverly written, and excellently voiced short tale about life, memory, making sense of the universe, and many other ever-relevant themes all people with even a little bit of soul constantly struggle with. I did cry at the end, for such a short experience you do become attached to the characters and the choices you make. The art style is also very nice, but sure, it's a very short game. So if you mind that, indeed wait for a sale, right now it's not exactly cheap for what there is here. You could stretch it to like 5-6 hours if you go for the collectibles, which are nicely done, but only found a couple of those. Mostly felt the need to partake in the story of these interesting people.   Overall recommended if you want something emotional, smart, but simple gameplay-wise, 7/10
Great short story with paranormal elements. Not a lot of action, a lot of talking, not a bad thing though. Game looks pretty cute as well. And the voice acting is superb.

The Graphics are decent for this game although there isnt much active gameplay besides walking around and clicking responses. What makes the game good though is the voice actors and the story. If you like tell-tale games this is similiar. 8/10

Odd game to say the least. While the dialog is very interesting, as are all the characters, the tempo of the game really bogs it down. Navigating around is painfully slow. Often you have to back track and get across the 'map' and that just isn't enjoyable.  While I did enjoy the story, I doubt I will ever bother to replay it just because of how slow everything is.

First of all, I love super natural story and 'point and click', however I really can't recommend this.   Presentation:   I have had enough of WASD. The whole game is walking from one place to another, quite repeative, but there is no running key.  I still can't believe that the developer makes such kind of mistake nowadays. It takes 4 or 5 minutes to get to another scene, and this is boring.  I pray to God that I haven't take a wrong way so that I have to back trace and crawl another 5 more minutes.   Story:   Peoples overate it. The story is straight forward without any plot twist.  The 'time loop' thing has potential, but the slow walking speed make this annoying.   Suggestions:   If you can't make 'the walking experience' as fun as 'Brothers - A Tale of Two Sons', then make the walking short, or make the character moves faster. I think this could be fixed easily in a later patch.  The story is fine, but not amazing. 'Soma', 'Gemini Rue', 'Life is strange' are amazing because they surprise me. That's how a 'story rich' game works.

Nothing about this game is egregiously bad. But the voice acting's slightly annoying, the characters and script aren't engaging, and the set pieces aren't terribly spooky.   I also dislike the fact that selecting my next dialogue option cuts off the person currently speaking.  All-in-all a surpisingly boring 2d walking simulator.
* rephrases what all the other reviews already tell you *

I think Oxenfree's story had some potential, but it mostly got wasted because of poor optimization (technical issues, bugs) and by some uninspired gameplay and writing. Too bad, It could have been a great adventure.
- Boring unskippable dialog from boring characters - Painfully slow movement - Awful control system. How did anyone think WASD was a good idea for what should be a point-and-click.
I tried on this one, but it is just too slow moving, both mechanically and the story.

It's not good. It has good art. But it's not good. The supernatural aspects are forced, and far from scary. The dialogue is completely awful. Walking around aimlessly takes up 75% of the game. Oxenfree takes all the cringe-worthy aspects of the impressive Life is Strange and haphazardly combines them with an after-school special. Unless it's on sale and you have a lot of time to kill, don't waste your money.
This has got to be the most dull game I have ever played.

I think it's too expensive. I finished the game in 3 hours. The replay value is not so great because the choices DON'T impact the story much. (ex: Which big decision do you do first? It doesn't matter because it just changes the order.)  You should consider buying it for 10$, otherwise I think it's overpriced.

God what a boring, tedious game.  The characters are possibly the most whiny, self-obsessed, stereotypical hipster teens from...I dunno...Seattle? And all they seem to do is boast about how they know everything there is to know, and ♥♥♥♥♥ about each other behind their backs.  I wanted them all to die. Seriously. It's a shame the game doesn't give that option.  And they NEVER seem to shut up. The only way your character has any input into the conversation is to constantly interrupt them by talking over, which is incredibly annoying because it means you're always breaking the flow of the dialogue to interject completely random comments.  The pacing is also terrible, too. Lots of walking left and right and left and right and backtracking to places at the other side of the map now you have a new MacGuffin. And for what? To 'unravel' a story which would have seem cliched and predicatable on 'The Twilight Zone'.  Avoid.

The game story is great, but the constant crappy dialog and the long cut scenes really killed it for me. Also there are several bugs which means restarting from last save and going through all that crappy dialog again. I finished the game, but God, my ears are bleeding from all the constand yapping. Control issues and tedious long walks also not helping. I'd stay away from this game.

Not my scene. Very slow, basic and gameplay very limited to simply clicking various dialog option. Felt like I was watching an audio book. As Im a FPS gamer I should have known better and as such got bored, fast.  Definatly not worth the fee thats for sure. The cost shouldnt be more than $5.
good thing theres refunds

Wow, really just wow. Between the great voice acting, creative story, and relatable characters, Oxenfree is a real gem, worthy of a few playthroughs.   The art style is quite nice, reminiscent of older animated movies and television shows from the late 90's and early 2000's. Backgrounds have a painted, rich feeling that really makes the map lovely to explore. The characters art is simple, but unique, drawing an image for the character, but not setting them into an archetype. This game is really wonderful to look at. The antagonist spirits appear as shadows, punctuated with partial red outline that gives them a certain alien feeling of wrongness. Overall the art sets the feeling of the game wonderfully and helps to draw in the player right off the bat.  The story and dialog are really inspired and very well done. At no point do the characters really become stereotypes, although a few characters aren't completely fleshed out, by the end. Exposition is carried out tastefully and naturally. Natural is actually a very good word for describing the majority of the dialog in the game, it feels normal, the conversations feel like conversations that real teenagers would have. Lately, some games with characters around this age have tried to shoehorn in pop culture references that often feel contrived and awkward. Oxenfree doesn't try this, opting to instead have the characters interact like normal people. Bolstered by some fantastic voice acting, the script is wonderful. The story is involving and smart, tying the characters together and moving forward at a good pace. Combined with optional collectibles scattered around the map, the story really builds the history of the island and surrounding towns into something memorable.  In terms of gameplay and puzzles, Oxenfree plays it simple and safe. Controls are basic, although traversing the map can get a little slow. The scenery is usually attractive enough to make the jogs between areas at worst acceptable, and at best a joy. The game is verging on being a walking simulator, with all of the puzzles being very simply moving the mouse left or right. Different dialog options and endings make the game's replayability high, along with finding all of the collectibles that aren't required, but help to complete the world.  The score for the game is fantastic, matching the mood perfectly, the soundtrack for this game goes up there with Transistor and Bastion as some of my favorite videogame music.   Without gathering collectibles, the game will take around 2-4 hours to complete for one playthrough, with another hour or so for gathering the collectibles. The game, in my opinion, deserves at least 2 full playthroughs, as there are many different possible endings and choices that can be made.  Tl;dr:  Pros: -gorgeous art -great voice acting -wonderful story and dialog -good atmosphere -beautiful music  Cons: -very simple puzzles -slow movement makes for a little slogging  I recommend this game to anyone who enjoyed Superbrothers:Swords and Sworcery and Kentucky Route Zero.
Deep storyline matched by sound, art, visuals, and 'narration gameplay' - the first of it's kind I've seen. Will be playing it a 2nd time through to see what other storylines I missed!

Cool game. Great story with brilliant voice acting.   My gripes are two:  1. The text bubbles are white font with light green backgrounds - making them very hard to read. In situations where you sometimes have to react quickly, this is a huge annoyance which shouldn't even be a problem. Black font would have fixed this; no idea why they chose to make the text white.   2. This one may just be me, but I would have appreciated a zoom feature. Being able to get a close up of the characters and backgrounds would be a nice feature. The wide shots are great for establishing the scenery, but I just want to zoom in every once in awhile to get a closer look.   Other than those two things, this is a superb game. A bit short with only a 4-hour playtime, but that's probably for the best - keeps the narrative tight and without needless fetch-quests and item hunts.   Definitely recommend this to anyone who likes story and dialogue heavy games.
Great game! I really enjoyed the dialog and getting to know the characters. Be sure to pay attention to whats going on and whats being said!!
I find this game really great but I can't help but to feel there's more to this game and it's driving me crazy.
I really enjoyed this game, the artwork, style, sounds, imagery and storyline were all brilliant.   Very interesting concept and at times very creepy!   Already reccomening to my friend.

Okay, I just finished the game so here is my opinion: Oxenfree has a really nice art and a good story. If you are into games that are all about the roleplaying than that's your game. Expect no action, battles nor exploration. It has none of those. But still is some money that I found worth spending.  And I do think you should give it a shot too! P.s.: The game crashes in transitions and that's kinda annoying... Not 'I want to kill myself' annoying but 'damn fly' annoying.

This game is fantastic. It has a great story with multiple endings.. If you're not into games that mostly depend on choices and want some kind of shooter this isn't the game. However, if you want a truly intelligent game with a creepy feel and great voice cast, I'd pick up Oxenfree. Some sequences are mindblowing and have amazing visuals. Oxenfree also has one of the best soundtracks and I'd recommend picking it up as well.

Fully enjoyed the whole game! Something new on the gameplay where it felt like a real life situation like how the characters talk to each other and we had to choose what we should respond in a short period of time to cut in a conversation. haha very fascinating! Love how the storyline is also unpredictable. Definitely well put together.

Chilling, atmospheric 2D adventure-game. Handling dialogue options/responses feels smooth and the story is engaging from start to finish. It's a four-hour game so while it's a good length for the story, it definitely makes the game's price a bit too expensive. There are some nasty bugs, voice acting/writing tries too hard to sound casual/natural and controls are quite awkward but other than that it's worth checking out. Especially Oxenfree's haunting atmosphere, horror elements and graphical presentation are excellent and leave a lasting impression.

Oh my god if you like creative puzzlers, branching stories, supernatural elements, or incredibly good games, oxenfree is a must play. the art style is beautiful, the story is dark yet inticing, the gameplay is incredible and the way the radio is used is utterly wonderful, I cannot reccommend this game enough.

This is from my channel when I was streaming the game: 'This is like the end of Twelve Monkeys came together with the end of Interstellar and had a love child with Twin Peaks. I'm so confused about what's going on.'

What kind of psychotic genius could have created this game? I just ate it up like a slice of cake! What a wonderful artwork, an original and modern ghost story, in a dreadfully immersive atmosphere... even if the characters are such boring teenager stereotypes (yet quite convincing most of the time). Then maybe the characters design is a bit too simple (especially when they're taking a selfie) BUT all the rest is so awesome ! The choices you have to make can be tough... The end gave me the thrills. I was like : Wait. What?? No ! Please don't let it end like this, I don't want it to end now noooooo YOU HEARTLESS ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥S WHO RUINED MY POOR BRAIN ! I think i'm gonna wait a few weeks (or a few months?) before I restart and try to modify that damned story!  PS : By the way, let me apologise if my english is not perfect...I'm trying hard I promess !
A nice departure from most games I've been playing. Great playable story with some room for replay. Feels a bit like if A Night Shamalamadingdong made a game. What a twist!

This is a fresh breath of a game with some interesting game-play specific concepts. Your actions and answers in conversations throughout the game will alter the ending in various ways. There is several hidden hints and extra information scattered throughout the game to find and for giving you a little more understanding of the backstory, but it is not necessary to find all the secrets to complete the game, but... just one more achievement... 4-6 hours of gameplay for a complete play through.
Really enjoyed this game, you should buy it if you like story driven games. Play it with a friend in the room watching/talking with you, it's better that way. Fun by yourself too, though.
Astounding game, deep plot and beautiful execution as well as stunning scenery and background. Was impressed to learn it was run off Unity! :D 10/10

I really enjoyed this game. The gameplay itself is mostly selecting dialogue options, walking and making decisions, with the ocassional and simple mini-game thrown in, but don't let that put you off.  The story and voice acting are fantastic, and I felt as though I was playing through a pretty decent and interesting movie, heavily influenced by my decisions.  Despite my 5 hour play time, it took me just under 4 hours to finish.   Highly recommended if you enjoy a good story, but don't expect too much in terms of gameplay; that's not what this is.

Oxenfree is a solid game. The story is interesting and quite original, you'll find yourself wanting to know more about the island, and the strange happenings that is occuring to your own character (Alex) and four other friends that your on this mystery island adventure with.   The dialogue is actually very natural, entertaining, and comedic. They really nailed this important part of the game. As a result I connected with all of the characters, maybe not Nona so much... But otherwise everyone has very distintive personalities, and people you may judge early on you can have a completely different opinion of later on in the game.   I've only played through once so far, and I feel like doing it again. So that's a good sign right? Repeat value, the alternative ending outcomes works well in it's favor.   It's not really scary, at all. But I don't think this was even an intent with the dev's, this is very much a casual indie game, and I loved this approach. Also the game really isn't a challenge in conventional ways. It simply forces you to make decisions which can possibly impact your friends lives in negative or positive ways, so if your into that sort of thing you'll probably love this game.   The art style is like a 10/10 lovely asthetic, it brings the world to life, seriously amazing job by their artists.   The soundtrack feels very carpenter inspired, with also what feels like a bit of a nod to disasterpeace. The composition are very minmalistic in nature, they never become to busy or present to completely pull you out of the immersive experience. The composer nailed the time period and atmosphere, but also showed a lot of restraint, yet the music never gets tiresome or to repatative. I loved how he processed all of the synth sounds with added tape delay giving that lovely wabble from the fluttering.   The sound effects are also spot on.   If you like mystery games, then I'm pretty sure you are going to want to experience this.   Rating: 8/10
This game is just..... amazing... idk what else to say other than you need to play this. Like pls play this, I promise you will not regret it.

I paid a bit for this game, my first game, i am new to games, last game i played was myst and simpson's hit and run, so now having a Mac, i didn't relaise there is a need for a mouse, thought i could just play this on a laptop using the keys, but this game needs a mouse with a right and left click button. i have a mouse but it has no right and left click button. so that ended my game experience unfortunately, liked the graphics and story, but can't continue to play, until i fork out funds for a mouse...oh well.

Love, love, loved this game. Some of the most believable characters I've ever seen in a game. Art was beautiful, acting was great, story was cool. Would've loved tougher puzzles but fantasitic overall

Oxenfree manages to do what few other games in the horror genre can: tell a geniunely creepy story without resorting to buckets of blood and jumpscares for cheap thrills. Night School Studio uses stylized art, a rich soundtrack, and a unique game mechanic (the protagonist has to tune into radio frequencies to solve puzzles) to create a foreboding atmosphere that has the player on the edge of their seat. This is a great way to spend the days leading up to Halloween.

This is a turn-based game for people who don't like turn-based games, and I am certainly one of the people. Well, for the most part at least. As of now, I haven't finished the game yet and I don't even know if I'm halfway through, but I'm confident that my opinions won't change after the hour and a half or so that I've played so far. Oxenfree is beautiful game - the sound design and art style is excellent, as well as the voice acting. The story is even a bit intriguing as well, which is something you want in a game with the tag of 'story rich,' I guess. I usually find turn-based games boring and lacking the 'thrill' that they try to provide, however, because Oxenfree still has that 'adventure' element (walking around to different places instead of just having your choices dictate where you go) I find myself a lot more interested that I initially thought I would. I bought the game on sale (something I'd wait to do even if you love turn-based games as this goes on sale moderately frequently) knowing that if I didn't like it I could just return it, and if I did I wouldn't have spent a lot of money on a game whose genre I'm not always fond of. So far, I'm loving Oxenfree. I found myself not wanting to put it down even though I knew I should in order to get some work done, something I didn't think would happen.  All in all, if you love turn-based games than this game is definitely for you, and if you love great game design (sound, art, etc) but are a little iffy about turn-based games, wait until it's on sale and give it a shot. I did, and I certainly don't regret it. Kudos to the developers for making an anti turn-based games guy like myself not want to stop playing one. I can't wait to finish the story.

This game is fantastic  It is rare that a game is able to convey horror elements so beautifully without using cheap jumpscares, and whatever jumpscares are in the game are not 'ahh! a monster!' but 'what just happened to my screen!'. also the characters interact very well. the dialogue is very fluid and natural, and it feels like they are having an actual conversation. The many secrets of this game make it VERY replayable and will have new things to find for many playthroughs. As someone who is not a fan of horror games, I greatly reccomend this game to anyone who wants a story rich game where your choices actually matter, unlike Telltale games.  Is. Leave. Possible?

I am new to gaming and I knew this game wasn't going to be a challenge, point and click games are basic in that sense. But then I saw the tag or review that mentioned the story and how well it flows. I didn't think I could be that interested in a basic game however I was blown away about the in depth characters and the various choices that truly made you say 'I don't want to be mean to Jonas, I should just tell him something positive'. I fell in love with the characters and the dialogue between them stuck me to this game. If you are new to gaming and thought gaming would be a good transition from reading a good book/comic, then get this game. If you like being attached to characters and forgetting for a split moment that this is just a game and isn't real, buy this game. If you are a human, buy this game.
Simply amazing. It was a great experience. The gameplay is easy, you don't have to have great skills, you just have to take decisions and that's all and this game doesn't need else.  It was a dream.

Talking Walking & Radio Sim.  No real spookies here, but a fun experience. Got in on sale, don't know if I could recommend it at full price due to the length (4 hours roughly) though there is apparently replayability via coversations and endings

All in all this was a pretty good story game. It leaves you with that AHHA! feeling at the end when everything gets pieced together.  I can't really think of anything negative to say other than sometimes the decisions you have to make where too quick. The choice bubbles would pop up in the middle of talking and you would have to make a choice before you knew what was fully going on or what they were going to end up saying. I'm not sure if these decisions fully effected the game at all though.  This game in full is probably about 6 hours. depending on if you take the time to find all the hidden items.  In order to get all the achievements, you will have to play through more than once.  I highly suggest playing the game through blindly the first time, and then your second time around play for the achievements you didn't get the first time through. This way you can kind of enjoy how the story develops instead of worrying about how to make this person like/hate me or make this person like/hate that person. Just enjoy it.
Got this in a humble bundle without actually looking at it. Played it, played it again, and started it up for a third playthrough. Short, but very engaging and has replay value.
Brillant. I loved the game. Got it with the Humble Bundle and this was the first game I tried. Had to tell my girlfriend to not come this weekend because I wanted to continue playing.
This is absolutely insane game! You need to play it! Great story that you will remember for the long time!
Really enjoyed the story and the character interactions. I will be playing this again as I can do better. Not sure what I did, but Clarissa doesn't like me. I know her better now, hope that helps.

I played it for like 10 min and I already liked it. I'm gonna continue playing it and its probably gonna get even more cooler.  Since this is a review I'll tell you why I liked it: - the actors ( voices ) are done beautifully. - the plot never keeps you bored and it keeps changing. - This game can make you so focused and it can make you laugh in the same time ( some jokes ). - as you start this game the mystery starts and while it unravels it also expands and creates more mysteries. - the dialog options dissapear faster if the plot is more 'active' which kinda makes it a bit life like, because lets be honest to make a response to something in RL you do it either instalty or you don't do it at all ( or you do but hey... ).  I'd add more but those could be considered spoilers so hey XD
When you just feel like some narrative and a bit of gameplay this is quite nice.

So like... pretty good game... I guess, maybe sort of... uhm, pretty graphics and, like, scenery and stuff but... you know, could have had some slightly better diaglouge... but... still, uhm... not too bad? Well, actually, pretty good. Super amazing characters and stuff... and, like... sort of an interesting plot, but... well... not, like, super deep or anything. Maybe a bit overhyped if you sort of ask me, but... whatever. Still play it... only if you want to though. Maybe... sort of... like... yeah.

I love this game, it has a great story and a really really amazing art style! I am going to replay it soon!  The only problem I had, perhaps since I am not a native english speaker, was picking up was was being said in the radio messages you get while standing close three stones on top of each other.  I tried turning on the subtitles, but these messages did not have subtitles, so perhaps it was supposed to be just jitter. I felt that I lost something though.

Oxenfree  is a nice adventure game with a teenage-driven storyline.   It probably has some inspiration from  Kentucky Route Zero , judging by the graphical style and the radio, which is a great thing. The mechanic of this game that stands the most to me, is the 'real-time' dialogue, in which you must respond to the characters in fashionable time and they shut up to hear just like in real life. Now that might be a bummer for people who are slow readers, but apart from that the mechanic works very good and is very nice implemented. Some people might be annoyed that the other characters sometimes shut up when you speak, which means that you won't get to see some lines, but that adds to the realistic feel of conversation that the game offers. And of course, none of that would matter if the voice acting was bad, but it's awesome. Very awesome.  By the end of the game, you'll have some optional challenges to discover even more about the secret story of the island, and besides that you have several endings, which means the game might grab you for some time. Unfortunately that didn't work out for me because the plot didn't really tick with me... And it's not because it's a teenager story, I actually found that very amusing, but because in the end it's like your actions don't really influence the course of things, and that doesn't allow me to sink into the story and feel it more personally. Moreover, while the main protagonists are characters with interesting backstories, the   ghosts who seem to be very important to the plot do not offer much character development  .  Besides that I still recommend the game, because I feel that overall it's worth it. It still got me engaged and I played it straight to finish. And it was fun! Meeting Clarissa, the brownies guy, and the step brother. I probably won't return to it but it was very nice while it lasted.

-- Some very minor spoilers ahead --  The thing I liked the most about this game is its dialogs. During an ingame conversation, you get limited time to choose what to say and if you don't - being quite is also an answer. The characters react very naturally and according to their personalities (and their relationship with you, which depends on your previous encounters with them). The time loop/dejavu is a pretty cool mechanic but it gets a bit dull towards the end of the game, because all the characters are able to acknowledge it. I think it would be cooler if you were the only one able to distinguish between the timelines. The radio mechanic was really cool, but felt a bit underused. I was hoping it would be more than just a resonance remote control. I kinda didn't like how you had to travel a lot in this game (and get stuck on corners), but I understand it's a vital part of the game and its atmosphere. There are multiple endings in the game, but they are not that drastically different. I didn't feel like replaying the game to unlock them, so I just googled them and they were meh to be honest.  Overall 7/10. Better than Life is Strange.
REALLY good storyline game. if you just want to be told a cool story and chill for some hours this is the game for you

Amazing game! I wanted to play it for a while but I wasn't sure if it was worth the money so I bought it when it was on sale and totally worth it! Loved the story and the characters. The dialogue feels natural (although I didn't like the fact you have to interrupt your companions sometimes when the dialogue bubbles come up) and fresh and the voice acting really impressed me. The mechanics are a bit tedious and slow but didn't bothered me that much. Overall a great game, if you liked Life is Strange you gonna love this one!  I'll probably replay it again to see the other possibilities :)

I got this game because it was on sale, and I had a few extra bucks left over from selling my CSGO skins. When I bought it, I think I remember it being $5.49 or something. For that price, the game is great! It provides 4-4 1/2 hours of solid gameplay. The story is very unique, the soundtrack is amazing and atmospheric, and what really sold me were the visuals. The art style of the game is great and really suits the entire theme of the game, no matter the context of the situation. When the game is first welcoming you, the graphics make you feel cozy and safe. However, when the 'scary' bits kick in, the art style succeeds at making you feel very uncomfortable.   While 90% of the game is great, there are some elements that are lacking. The one that really stood out to me was the voice acting. You'd think that your friend staring at you with red glowy eyes would be enough for you to have a mental breakdown. Guess not. And the AI that follows you around is very bad. I had to restart an entire chapter because Jonas couldn't climb up the rocks.  This game is great, but not worth the original $21.99 that it is here in Canada.  Do I reccomend this game? Yes.
Pretty interesting game. Loved the characters.. The music .. The story .. The art style .. EVERYTHING!! Really, everything was on point. I enjoyed it so much and I absolutely recommend it.
If you loved Netflix's 'Stranger Things', you'll love this!!  And vice versa ;)  9/10
- Great Story - Great Characters - Good Gameplay - Not to stretched
Amazing game! Great story and the music is simply perfect. 10/10

A playable ghost story meets young adult novel. Otherworldy phenomona occuring in relation to radio signals. Sacrastic teenagers cracking wise. Dialogue options to change your relationships with the other teens on an ongoing basis. That always proves pretty intriguing.   The otherworldly twists kept me shocked, startled, and even awed (but not scared -- I would not call this a horror game, and people who dislike horror games will still enjoy this). I enjoyed it very much, and now I'm going back in to persue some other endings (the endings relate to how your relationships with the other teens developed).  P.S. Repeat plays give you some interesting things to chew on.
Gooooood Scenes good story totally recommend

Maybe I'm biased because the developers were nice enough to give me a review code, but the game was one of my favorite games after only a few hours. The story is good, and the game has good mechanics and a pretty graphic style. The characters are fun, and seem like they could be real. 10/10

A great indie point-n-click that has a wonderful sci-fi story and soundtrack. The tiny changes to the story makes you want to play it more than once to gain the full story and see the different outcomes.
My Favourite Indie game this Year! Superb Storytelling, Voice Acting and Art style, with a killer Soundtrack
The plot twist at its best. Enjoyed the story as well as the critical choice making throughout the gameplay.
Excellent story, voice acting is superb, and the music is great. What more could you want?? It isn't a long game, but there is replayablity.

Take one teen adventure movie (late 80's to early 90s will do), scoop out contents and set aside. Thinly slice some Twin Peaks, X-Files, Twilight Zone (can be substituted with The Outer Limits if needed) and a fresh sprig of Stranger Things. Simmer in a hot pan for 20 minutes, turning after 10. Serve with headphones in the dark.
Great game.
Plot twists everywhere!

The walking can be a bit tiresome at times, but the story and characters are excellent. It's probably even scarier than a lot of self-labelled horror games (I never tought that an adventure game could creep you like that!).   If you're interested in playing it, don't read too much about it and give a try, it's better to go in spoiler-free.
Great, interactive, and fun game, with a fantastic atmosphere.
If you like simple gameplay with Great Story, Great characters, and Great Visuals. Oxenfree is a must game to play for you.

Oxenfree is a game about 5 teens that go on a camping trip for the rest of their lives. If you don't play the game, at least do yourself a favor and listen to the soundtrack, as the soundtrack essentially makes the game the amazing that it is.

This game has an amazing storyline, and gives an amazing connection to the characters.  It can run on crappy computers and is definetly worth the money. Replay value and the community for this game is amazing.

Just loved this game, it turned out to be so much more than i was expecting. From the lovely water colour graphics, to the deep and interesting story...that you will care about. The game plays a bit like an interactive audio book. which may not sound great in theory. But with some of the best voice acting i have ever come across, it's great in practice. I got totally swept up in the history of the island and the lives of the characters. To the point were i felt a real emotional connection to them.  If you like mystery books or ghost stories this is for you. I strongly recommend trying this one. It's one of the best impulse purchases i have ever made.
One of my favorite games of the year

This game is incredibly beautiful and very well thought out, with a plot that changes even when you've played the whole game through, and a multitude of endings that will have you going back again and again trying to save everyone-or kill them all.

Oxenfree is an emotionally charged game that cleverly takes advantage of player-choice mechanics.   There's much to be said about the positives of this game: whimsical graphics, an eerily beautiful soundtrack, well-defined characters with fantastic performances by their voice actors. The story follows Alex in such a way to reveal important information about her and her situation without spelling it out for the player, and the player gets to know Jonas in the same way that Alex does. The game isn't *terrifying*, but I admit I was startled quite a few times while playing -- enough to keep me on my toes, but not too much to make me anxious about playing.   Things I didn't like about the game? Well, there's not much to dislike, to be honest. I guess the speed at which the characters walk and climb objects is annoying, but a lot of the time, the dialogue fills in that space, and makes it less boring. The mechanics of the radio aren't super fun, either. It's an essential portion of the game, yet I had issues with the radio closing out when I was turning the dial, and making me repeat sequences of tunings over again. This, in itself, would be a harmless glitch if it didn't take forever to change the channel on the radio. It made discovering the 'anomalies' disinteresting to me since it just took so long to walk to the rocks and then tune the radio to the right station. But maybe I'm just too impatient.   A lot of choice-based games seem to streamline their endings (Life is Strange, one of my favorite games, is guilty of this); I didn't feel this was the case with Oxenfree. I felt like the things I said did have an impact on the game, and ultimately its end. And like I mentioned before, the voice acting was phenomenal. Personally, I would've been a bit more choked up about the situation than these characters were, but hey, to each their own. It's refreshing to play a storyline that doesn't have romance thrown in just to attract players -- Alex stands alone, and her relationship with other characters seems on a strictly platonic level. This means no gimmicky love crap, which I am sick of seeing! But honestly, this game was so well-executed that if they had thrown in a romantic interest for Alex, I don't think I would've been so bothered by it.   So what do I want to see more of? GAMES LIKE THIS. Real characters with interesting personalities, a gripping storyline, immersive sound effects, and simplistic yet gorgeous graphics make this game really come into its own. Night School Studio really delivered on this one, and I am already hoping to see them pursue other games of this style.  All in all, should you buy the game? For $20, I say go for it. You've got to be willing to listen to the story, though. Otherwise, what's the point?

This game is immensly interesting and weird! There is fast paced dialouge that doesn't give you time to think just react. It has funny parts, scary parts, and a whole lotta twitsts. The Game really only gets better the more you play it. I highly reccomend it for anyone who likes stories.   All hail triangulus.
A strange Supernatural mystery that can get downright unnerving at times

Amazing game the only issues I could bring up is that there are some bugs with the other characters not moving when they are ment to resulting in freezing the game also there are a few typos in the subtitles and parts where it doesn't match what the audio is saying but aside from that this is a wonderful game and if you are a fan of other narrative driven games such as life is strange or the telltale franchise I highly reccomend giving this game a shot.

Loved this game. Creepy (but not too bad), atmospheric and charming. The dialogue makes you really invested in the characters, and the game mechanics are really neat. The score is fantastic, really sets the tone. This is one of those games that rewards being thorough, so look at everything. And your choice of dialogue actually affects the outcomes, so choose wisely (but be quick).  This one may even be worth another play-through. It's not very long, maybe 3-6 hours. Best played all in on go, so set aside a good amount of time. If you leave the game early, you'll probably end up repeating a few things.  Would recommened this to anyone who like story driven games. Not for the action-loving types. If I had to name something that I think could have been improved on, I would have liked the ending (before the epilogue) to have been a bit more clear/explainy/revelatory. But it's very possible I just missed something the first time through, and the epilogue was great, so I'm not really going to complain.

Oxenfree is a very entertaining bite-sized game that can be completed in day. Two days if you take your time.  Overall I enjoyed the character dynamics and mysteries of the island. There are some real moments that make just want to strangle a character or two, but to me that just underscores the quality of the writing. The dialogue is quite clean and natural sounding; however I decided to turn on subtitles as it helps with some of the conversions throughout the game.   There are a few technical issues I noticed though, like a somewhat sticky world when trying to go up stairs. Once, my character got stuck climbing, but then snapped to the top. Once I was with one character, but got the voice of another. Another problem is the choice bubbles are sometime off-screen if you're on an incline.  These issues are not deal breakers, but can certainly break immersion. Those issues aside, I enjoyed the game and definitely recommend it if you're in the market for a cerebral exploration game.

I absolutely love this game. It has likeable characters, clever dialogue, great voice acting, engaging story and atmosphere, beautiful art style, good soundtrack and smooth character animations. I also appreciate the fixed camera view which helps to capture the scenery very well. My only issue is the irregular movement speed. There's no separate run/sprint button, so you're pretty much stuck with whatever the main protagonist decides to do, whether she's jogging at a brisk pace or calmly strolling through the area, depending on how much dialogue is going on at the present time. I can forgive this, though, as it helps add to the story.

Despite being Sci-fi horror adventure, Oxenfree is just delightful to look at, at anytime. Normally I would avoid getting thriller or horror related games, because I'm a giant wimp, but the trailer filled with eerie-looking forests and mountains with surprisingly beautiful presentations/effects caught my eyes. And it certainly delievers on that part with gorgeous sounds. It may not be the most beautiful game on everyone's list, but it certainly must be near the top.   The gameplay is interesting enough. Typical side scroller with a little amount of puzzle solving. But the decision making felt a little weak for me, maybe becuase it's not that big game so I can't feel the weight of all decisions. I don't know.  The story is engaging. It's a game about solving mysteries afterall. Although, It has some backtracking at the end when you figured out what's going on around you, but like I said it's really a short game so that wouldn't matter too much.  Again, I cannot stress enough how beutiful this game both looks and sounds, absolutely making my few complaints about this game very trivial.
The story is good. The art is fantastic. Didn't feel too long or too short. I really really like this game. Good ♥♥♥♥.
Superb voice acting, one of the best I've seen in a video game. Feels really natural.

This game is Amazing, not just for the Art style but the story drives you to try to make the Main Character Alex be the best she can be. There are many twists and turns and your brain will hurt but at the end you want to know more. If you want to be left standing saying 'what just happend to me' this is a great game for it but make sure you go in with a heavy heart and a blank head.

Well, let's see: - graphics - nice backgrounds/effects (awesome looking radio tunner), but sometimes cliffs/paths are too darks to see. - gameplay - a part of it is standart adventure game loop (go there, look at that, find this). Some parts are linear but there are choices. It's character-driven game, so you need to (or not) care for relationships between them. But the part where it shines most is the radio mechanics. A gorgeous radio tuner scale popups when press a button and you can tune to different frequencies. It simulates an analogue radio, so you never get a perfect singal. There are some interferences, sometimes static, sometimes something important. Some messages needs to be written down (get some pen and paper). It's awesome. - AI - what AI? Where there is only one type of AI there - other NPCs follow main character. Nothing special, except that they can get stupid and blocked on cliffs/jumps. But Devs said they are working on fixing that. - sound - brilliant. There are some jump scares, there are some environmental sounds. And there is a radio and everything related to it. Brilliant. - music - very solid soundtrack. So solid that it's worth buying it separatly. It fits the game and it's good to listend outside the game. - plot/worldbuilding/characters - I can't say anything about this without spoling it. If you are afraid that this is a game about 'idot teenagers' then don't - they don't follow most of the stereotypes. They are actually nice and I think they will spawn some fanbase (There are already some ships sailing ^_^ ). Overall I really liked it. Yes it's short, but you can play it more then once (again - can't say why).

Loved this game! The voice acting can't be beat. The store is rich and kept me guessing. I also really liked how there are many alternate endings. This makes it so you can play this games multiple times and achieve different milestones in each ending. Very happy with my purchase and would buy again!

This is one of the best games I've ever played. It's atmospheric horror that makes you care deeply about the characters. Nearly everything the main character, Alex, says is what you told her to say, making the big choices feel natural after you've made so many little ones.The story  feels  desperate as you try to figure a way out of the mess you're in, to the point where I felt uncomfortable leaving the game.  Also, the music is freaking fantastic.
Amazing game. Hard to describe. Some small things that could be fixed to finesse (spelling mistakes etc) but wow. I spent all day playing this when I should have been working.

While the traversal can be a bit slow, and I ran into a couple of bugs halting my progress, its not enough to stop me from giving this game an excellent review. The gameplay consists of dialogue interactions and some slight memory puzzles. What makes this game memorable however is the amazing dialogue system, perhpas the best I have ever played. The interactions and conversations are extremely natural, deftly handling interruptions and reacting to your choices or your choice to say or do nothing. I was constantly engaged while uncovering the mystery of the island and unraveling the past of the characters; it always seemed there was a revelation or interesting item around the corner. This is all framed by top notch sound and a pitch perfect sound track that really sets the mood. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Wow, what a ride! The story and animation were truly captivating and it just kept me awake with excitement throughout the game. The protagonist and support characters were actually likeable, even though some of the dialogues were too cliche and cringy. Really recommend this game!

This game didn't let me sleep. Like at all. It is such an amazing game! Great soundtrack, great plot. It remind me of Until Dawn with options of responses in conversation between characters. If you're into to just more of story plot than action then this is the game for you! :D

Oxenfree is a point and click style adventure game, mixed with a dash of Telltale's signature branching dialogue structure. Giving details on the plot would really just ruin things, but suffice to say if you like early Spielberg, Stephen King, or Stranger Things, you'll find something to like here. I really enjoyed the graphic style, soundtrack and the overlapping nature of the dialogue. It really is some of the most organic writing I've experienced in any game or movie, I think, to date. The writing and structure is truly a unique accomplishment in a game that juggles a lot of narrative elements without overwhelming the larger plot.
nice game very pretty
This game is one of the most atmospheric psychological trillers i've ever seen ;_; 10/10
Wow! This Game is amazing with perfect dialogue and smooth animation, i can surely recommend this game! Also, Loved the ending a whole bunch!! 10/10

Best Horror-Story-Adventure-...thing I've played in a while. Top storytelling, top story and a pretty satisfying    and happy (Yes Life is Strange, I see you pretending not to see me!)    ending. Characters are jerks but really well written and the dialogue is the most dynamic I've ever seen, resembling an actual conversation. Good intrigue, a tense, scary atmosphere and some notes to think about afterwards.  Recommended for people who liked: Until Dawn, Life is Strange, Walking Dead (and other Telltale games) Playtime: 4h, good replay value, New Game +

This game is incredibly beautiful and atmospheric. And quite creepy. Turn your volume up or wear headphones to get the most out of this. At the moment, I've just finished my first run-through of the game. I'm very interested to see how things go my next time around.  The story is compelling and mysterious. You have to figure things out the best you can, playing around with the radio a lot and seeking out the collectables will help with that. I really love story rich games where your choices affect other characters' interactions with you and drive the story in different directions. This game certainly fulfills that.  I will note that as I started, I had difficulty with veeeeery slow framerate. It ended up being an easy fix, combination of turning off details in the game and needing to manually add Oxenfree to my Nvidia. No problems after I made those adjustments.  Highly recommend the game. It seems like it has high replay value, which I really look forward to.

I totally LOVE this game. The characters are really nice and the dialogue feels natural. Also the story is both creepy and funny at times and there are so many ways to deal with the different things that are going on. Furthermore... There are SO MANY endings and plot changes throughout the whole game. I personally can't wait to explore all possible endings!

Really good characters and dialog. You connect with all of them, in their own ways. The story was quite good, but not amazing.   It took me 3h to finish the game but I think I'm going to play it again and ♥♥♥♥ around in my choises. If eveybody doesn't hate me at the end, and the world isn't burning, I did something wrong.   I had some problems with the npc's getting stuck when clibing up things, but all I had to do was climb down, and up again, and the problem was solved. That, as well as that it was a bit tedious running around sometimes was the only 'big' negatives.  It was totaly worth the buy during summer sale.

If you love narrative-focused games, Oxenfree will scrath that itch. With some light puzzle elements, the game's story might seem straightforward initially, but as you progress, a deeper narrative emerges.  At times I realised I wasn't thinking about the characters in the game, instead of the choices that I've made in my own life, and if there is such a thing as fate.  Along with an awesome twist in game mechanics toward the end of the game, Oxenfree is wholeheartedly recommended.

I have always wanted to be a broken H.S. girl, and this game has finally given me that chance! Teenage Girl in a supernatural setting simulator fun yo!  You play Alex, a high school girl who brings her new step brother to meet her friends at a beach party on an isloated island. Basically, the game is about Alex and a small group of unsupervised children running amok on an island. They inadvertantly release something unworldly that should not have been released. Now its a fight against time to figure out what to do and enjoy some magic brownies. There are some stories that you can uncover, and discoveries you can make about the island and your friends. It was an enjoyable game.
Very short game but also kind of chill/comfy. Get it when it's on sale.

Wow. Damn.  This is an incredible, creepy, and thrilling game set on an 'Edwards Island'.   You control a character named Alex, and it's somewhat of a choose your own adventure story game that follows along a set storyline. Throughout the game, you use your radio to pick up odd signals and discover some secrets. I'm not going to spoil further, because I think whoever is reading this should get the chance to enjoy this game on their own.  The voice acting is superb, and it has some replayability.   9/10, Great game. somewhat annoying controls on my part, and good soundtrack. It's kinda short though, but that's ok.

Having slightly mixed feelings about this one. I'm not a huge fan of backtracking. The game would have benefited of a dedicated ''run'' buttom, when you are stuck at the more 'slow/boring' parts in the game. Oxenfree's radio mechanics was something I hadn't seen been done In a video game before, the same can be said about the dialogue system, and I though it worked great. The artstyle fits the game perfectly. At least you get to look at gorgeous artwork, while you snail your way through the island. Some people might think the voice acting are a bit cringeworthy, in the same way Life is Strange was (which I personally didn't mind at all) At times I felt that the developers could have pushed the plot and horror a bit further, to really deliver on the shock effect, which is why i reccomend getting the game at a sale.  Anyways. When Oxenfree is at it's best it really shines.  Play it in one sitting if you got the time and don't care to much about collectibles and achievements.

For me, this game's dialogue tree was the real hook. While each of the characters fits into a familiar archetype (goofy stoner, ♥♥♥♥♥y cool girl, troubled step-brother), they feel like actual people with fully-realized identities. That the game makes you care about their fictional lives and whether or not they survive the night is a big reason to play if you enjoy story- and dialogue-driven games.  Another thing people have praised is the art, and I have to tell you that I dragged my roommate (a graphic designer) over to check it out with me. She was ecstatic, which told a layperson like me, 'Yes dummy; it's pretty.'  I have 1 criticism, and it is by no means game-breaking.  The lack of a sprint option means your character and her follower(s) trudge through the world at a base that does not --quite-- sell the, 'Holy crap we need to solve this so we can go home alive in the morning!' vibe. Thankfully, the game's small map and relatively short length will ease any concerns you have about the slow walking pace. I don't think the developers overlooked putting one in there: most of the time that you're walking there's dialogue occurring, so you WANT to hang back and not jump to the next part of the map for fear of missing something interesting. It's when you draw close to the end-game and you're trying to finish some of the collectibles for an achievement and there's no more dialogue unless you move the plot forward that it really stands out (which was in large part my own fault for not getting them while I was in the area). I would have LIKED the option to jog, but I also think it would have been detrimental for this game, as it relies heavily on its excellent dialogue and story to keep the player interested.  -----------------Potential Spoiler Below-----------------  Having finished the game once, I don't quite know how to interpret the ending. While I managed to save everyone, it all felt a little TOO perfect. I was suspicious about how neat a bow was being tied over our experience, and my suspicions seemed (somewhat) confirmed by my best friend Ren repeating something he'd said on the ferry ride to the island the day before. Maybe I'm reading into it too much... or maybe we didn't get away quite as unscathed as we thought. <___<
Great Game.  A unique approach to decision making and a very interesting story. Artwork is fantastic. Really fun to play.
A great adventure game. Do not spoil your experience, just dive right in. My playthrough lasted for roughly 4 hours. Money and time well spent IMHO.

This game has an amazing way of story telling. If you just want to go through the game once $20 might be a bit much, however there are lots of Diderot paths you can take so replaying won't feel too much like the same thing over again. I'm really looking forward to what Night School Studio comes up with next.

Excellent artwork and atmosphere. My only complaint is that the voice acting, while good, doesn't fit with the eerie tone of the game. Really enjoyed my playthrough and the ability to unlock different endings gives it some replayability. Didn't even know about the game until the summer sale and am glad I picked it up! Excited for what Night School Studio does next.
Loved it. Beautiful art, engaging dialouge and an amazing soundtrack make for a really incredible game and experience.
The game has a very good story and voice acting. The game is a very paranomic horror vibe in the gameplay and it does seem to go away even after a few play throughs.
Definetly one of the better suspense games I've played.
This is a pretty short game, but worth every penny! The atmosphere is creepy, and the story telling is top notch. There is plenty of room for a sequel, which I hope eventually happens!
One of my favourite games!  Characters, visuals, sound, story, exploration, REPLAYABILITY <3  12/10
Its short and sweet. Worth the money when its on sale

Waited for a long time for a sale on Oxenfree, which if I could go back in Time to kick myself in the ♥♥♥ and purchase immediately, I would :) Memorable and highly likeable characters, simplistic gameplay that does nothing to harm the experience, and an intriguing yet unexpectedly dark plot. I knew within the first 5 min of playing this game I needed snacks and a drink because I wasn't moving until this game was done. The urge to discover the mystery and obtain answers to Oxenfree is absolutely addicting. Doesn't matter if it's on sale or not. BUY IT. Your money is well spent. If you love stories in your games, if you enjoy having games make you feel the very wide spectrum of emotions that a person can feel, THIS IS THE GAME FOR YOU. So what are you waiting for? 'Tune in to the Source' already ;)

I'm an incredibly picky gamer and I essentially never write game reviews, but just trust me when I say that if you've shown enough intetrest in the game to watch the trailer and read the comments then get this game ASAP- it has one of the best stories out of any game that I've ever played.

Nice adventure game about a ghost story with teens on a deserted island. It sounds pretty hokey based on that description, and there are elements of cringey dialog and various teen tropes, but on the whole it works pretty good.  The art style is very nice, and the voiceovers are fairly well done.  I understand there are multiple different endings; I've only played through once.  It does have some parallels with Life is Strange that are hard to shake: the girl with the blue hair overcoming a death in her family, some supernatural nonsense that you have to take as presented, and the apparent variability in the story based on your decisions.  Walking around the island was a bit tedious for me, so I'm not sure I'm up for a second playthrough to explore the various other storylines, but I can't really say anything bad about the game - it's very well crafted.  I'd give this a 4 out of 5. If 2.5D-ish adventure games are your thing, this is certainly a good example of the genre.

I don't know how to do this game justice without spoilers. So all I will say is that as the credits were rolling I wasn't even tempted to get up or alt-tab, but let the final mesmerizing bars and thoughts wash over me.
This is the only game I've ever reviewed. Telltale but better. That is all I need to say.

Really good game. Don't read up on it before playing, go in blind. The music is great, the story is interesting, and the characters are well thought out.  I got this game on a 75% discount, but I'd say it's worth full price.
This game is like real good.

TL;DR:  Oxenfree is a graphically beautiful game with a gorgeous soundtrack, generous effects, a satisfying plot, and diverse characters that you don't have to love. Finding collectables is fun and doesn't feel like a chore, but not necessary if you find that part tedious. The tutorial is a little mediocre and glosses over a lot, especially when it concerns the radio mechanic and what you can do with it, so you may have to backtrack later on because of things you missed when you didn't understand it. Characters  will  talk over each other, and you  will  talk over them when you make any choices, so be prepared for multiple playthroughs to hear everything they have to say.    Oxenfree has been on my wishlist for nearly as long as it's been out, and I only recently bought it because it was on sale for $5 and I was afraid that I wouldn't like it and didn't want to pay full price. I probably couldn't have been more wrong.  To begin, Oxenfree is a 'supernatural thriller' about five teenagers who get stuck on an island and accidentally awaken some kind of omnipiscent, timeline-screwing beast residing on the beach.  What I liked about it: the soundtrack is gorgeous and really helps make the mood of the game, I was tentative to buy the music as well, but I was sold about halfway through the game. I found myself even thoroughly enjoying the ambience when there was no music. Given a few more hours of playtime, I would definitely start humming along to the more upbeat tunes.  The story is great, I felt immersed for all five hours I played this (accidentally played right through without a break, whoops). At first it may seen cheesy and just like any other romp about five teens on an island looking for some fun and relaxation, but the characters really came alive after a while, and the plot just keep right on going.   The beautiful graphics also sucked me in. The backgrounds are superb and the effects added during pivotal points are just all so  right . Not to mention that the extra artwork (i.e., the photos you receive) is incredibly good and so adorable. My only criticism is how the character models themselves looked, and perhaps it's only because I have a large monitor, but they seemed kind of polygonal and rough, almost like PlayStation 2 graphics. It's not crazy though, and I still very much enjoyed the graphics, especially the winding pathways and diverse environments.  Gameplay was also super, I adored the main mechanic in the game a lot, and it was really easy to use. I only wish that I had found out   how to use the radio for the anamolies and other radio-specific tidbits of information earlier,   it would have made some bits of the game a lot easier than they were,   (especially the quiz part in the facilities, whose answers I all found after the fact)   and I felt like I was  supposed  to find them earlier, and I just didn't know what to do with them.  This brings me to my next point: some parts of the tutorial were lackluster, and I missed out on lots of extra flavor text early on because I must have missed the fact that pressing 'spacebar' would have you interact with things. Additionally, characters talked on top of one another a lot, and whenever you make choices, you have to make them fast, even if characters are still talking, which forces you to miss out on so much dialogue because your character interrupts them whenever you make a choice.  Regardless, there are certain aspects and mechanics of this game that I absolutely loved but can't explain out of fear of releasing spoilers. For those that have played the game, I think I really loved the help you can receive from the community, and the help that you can give back. It really ties together the idea of the multiverse theory or whatnot.

This game sucked me into from the start. From the relatable, well fleshed characters and the amazing, eerie soundtrack to the replayability and width of the plot.   Here is a list of Pros: -------------------------------------------------------- - Graphics (well made, stylish. Altogether, pretty nice at higher resolutions) - Soundtrack (When one of the key components of the game is a radio    that is used to tune in to certain things for various results   the sound better be good, and they delivered. This game has a soundtrack that really carries the feel of the game - Characters (sure, they may seem a little cliche at times, but all the characters were well developed. They each had their own complexities. I felt connected to each of them while playing.) - Choices (The choices really bring this game to what it is. In many games, you have a black and white, good and evil, choice, but in this game everything you say can and will be used   against you in the court of the dead [kinda{depending on how you play you}]  . The amount you affect the game creates the depth it needs.)  Cons -------------------------------------------------------- - Controls (somestimes the controls got me momentarily stuck on a corner, petty I know) - Plot depth (I have not as much as some, but the story may be a little shallow. This was not a problem for me at all, because I genuinely enjoyed every character.)  I recommend this game. Just don't play it too stoned, home alone, in the middle of the night. For those of you that this is a normal occurance, I do not recommend this game... Trust me. That is a warning...
Pretty cool game. Longer than I expected.

This is quite short. The choices you make don't affect the fundamental story, but they do affect character interactions, and who eventually ends up liking whom. The main story is an odd horror/fantasy/science-fiction mix, although none of the current protagonists gets hurt, or even seriously frightened. It's more about 18-year olds feeling their way through learning about relationships, without enough game time for meaningful exploration. Nevertheless, it was interestingly diverting. I paid $5 for it, and was quite happy with it at that price.

I never write reviews for anything, but the naturally flowing and intricate story in this game was incredible so I felt I had too. The style of the game was unique, and I was left baffled at every twist and turn that happened throughout. Worth the money, and the few hours it takes to complete. However, I feel this game is something you have to 'complete' multiple times to truly understand what's happening and what role you play. 5/7 perfect score.

Best game I've played this year. Not AAA but it is certainly the most immersive game I've seen  It takes other people choices made at the end and immerses them to other player going through it after  For example: (Spoilers) If your friend finished the game at some point you might encounter him through mirrors with the choice he made at that specific spot at the end  I would give it a 10/10 Best game 2016 has to offer -Unique character design -'Write your own story' Playthrough -Good Music -And very very very unique art style

This game is beautiful, and I'm planning on replaying it a few times to get all the achievements. It has a series of weird bugs, though. Nothing debilitating or even close, just minorly annoying. They quickly resolve themselves, though. The saves are also relatively far apart. Gorgeous game, though, with an interesting storyline.

For several months I was entranced by this game. I Still think about the experience I went through every here and there.  It's not that long of a game, but if a game... haunts you like the way this one has, not in a scary way, but in a way that makes you think, then it's an experience worth having.  It's a ghost story that manages to haunt you rather than give you a heart attack, and that's what makes it darn good.  From the atmosphere, to the dialouge, to the story, to the smart design of this game... I love it all.  If I continue with this review it's probably going to fall into spoiler territory.     I went to Seattle for this game for it's ARG. OF COURSE I'm going to give it game a positive review. Also, if you're reading this part, ignore it. I've said too much.

I bought this game on sale. I didn't really know what it was about or what kind of gameplay it contained, but the artwork looked good and the gameplay video seemed interesting. I'm glad I took the chance. I was quickly sucked into the story. It was paced extermely well, written wonderfully, and the voice acting is perfectly performed. I don't often write reviews of games, but this one really stood out to me. I'd gladly pay the full price if I was to buy it again.   The only issue I could see anyone having with the game is its length. I finished the story in around 5 hours. That being said, there are reasons to replay the story. As a matter of fact, I instantly started a second playthrough upon completion of the first.  In stort, buy the game. You won't regret it.

I'm recommending Oxenfree on the assumption that if you're reading these reviews you already have an interest in these types of games. If you don't, you can stop reading now and not bother with the game.  Oxenfree is pretty much a point-n-click adventure game without the point-n-click. Rather than clicking on stuff you just move around and tap a button or maybe whip out your radio and dial into a certain frequency to interact with stuff; the vast majority of the 'gameplay' is spent moving around and solving some really light puzzles. Don't expect anything stellar in that regard; it works just fine, but it doesn't excel.  The real draw of the game is the well-written characters and the decision-making, and fortunately you'll spend a lot of time with just that. The choices you make are fairly interesting and the dialogue is top-notch; if that's what you're here for then you won't be disappointed. There's also a bit of a twist to the decision-making that I think is super cool and I've never seen it done in any video game before. Saying any more would move into spoiler territory so I'll leave it at that.  Unfortunately, the game is bogged down by two things: an overall lackluster narrative and excessive travel times and backtracking. The narrative is gripping for about the first two-thirds or so, but takes a nose dive near the end. The atmosphere is fantastic and spooky, there're a couple good scares, and the mystery is compelling and you're drip-fed information at a nice pace at first, but it becomes a bit predictable eventually and has, in my opinion after having just finished the game, a non-sensical and generally underwhelming finale with the exception of that unique decision-making thing I mentioned earlier. As for the travel times and backtracking, most of the levels are pretty boring visually after the second or third time through and out of the roughly ten areas in the game you return to three or four several times while only visiting the others once. The levels are large and, for the most part, empty; this makes sense the first time you go through them as it gives you time to listen to dialogue and decide what to say next but with the backtracking it gets old fast, especially if you want to get all of the collectibles, which you probably will because they have interesting little tidbits of lore or world-building in them.  If you've got five or so hours to blow and just want to make some decisions and be taken on a ride without worrying about any of that pesky gameplay stuff, you could do a  lot  worse than Oxenfree.
The 'mirror reflection' moments really screwed my head so much   Props to you devs for making that mechanics
I was skeptical at first about getting this game but my friend insisted on it so i did. I was very pleased with my purchase and highly reccomend this for anyone who is thinking of buying it

Loved 'Life is Strange'? Buy this game, you will love this one too.  Just a great experience and a great game overall. Yeah, it has some terror in it, you enjoy it :).  PLAY ON A FRIDAY NIGHT !!!! GREATLY INCREASES THE EXPERIENCE!!! ;D   Final Veredict: 8,50/10 - Playing again.
Really quite very good. The dialogue system makes it worth playing alone.

A splendid game by the fantastic Night School Studio. The story is compelling and enjoyable, managing to be sweet, serious, light-hearted and spooky with an accompanying soundtrack that really sets the mood. The characters are enjoyable and relatable, the dialogue is entertaining and the art is just perfect. And that's not even including the ARG! If you enjoy a thriller with characters you can be invested in then this will be right up your alley!

Oxenfree is truly an amazing game, it's potentially the first one i've ever played that had realistic and well developed teenagers. The story is great, the voice acting is great, the music is great, everything is great. Do yourself a big favor, get this game and play it all in one or two sittings. You won't regret it.

Man, I have been long overdue in writing a review for this game. I've played it maybe four or five times, now, and still haven't found all the little exciting tidbits that really bring it to life. I think it takes me about four hours for a single playthrough, and every time, I find myself playing through the whole game in one sitting. It's an enthralling storyline, with great charaters, and I absolutely adore the concept. I don't get fully invested in games very often, but this is one I think I'll still be playing for a long time to come. The designs are gorgeous, the dialogue is on point, and I still feel immersed in the game every time I play.

Oxenfree is a game that I couldn’t stop playing! After unintentionally rushing through my first playthrough I went back a second time to make sure I didn’t overlook anything and, turns out, I had. This game packs a lot of content into one thrilling adventure and I got super attached to the characters. I discovered an ending that made the game feel complete for me but that won’t stop me from going back and getting the fire starter achievement.  Thematically, this game is spot on. The environments coupled with the killer soundtrack leave such an impact.  In summary, you should play this game multiple times. Achievement hunting is actually fun and the multiple endings give you a real sense that your choices matter.

I wasn't expecting the level of creepiness that I got from this game--and I mean that in a good way. It has an interesting relationship mechanic, if a bit vague sometimes in terms of whether your actions have illicited a positive or negative reponse. The writing and voice acting is really good, which leads you to care about the characters. That makes it all the more unnerving once things start to happen to them. I'll just leave it at that. It's a little slow at times, but definitely worth a try if you like character-driven adventure games.

In Oxenfree, you play as Alex while her and her 'friends' are getting ready to celebrate the end of their school year. What starts of as a seemingly normal ghost tale eloquently weaves in a paranormal story with enough twists and turns to keep players wanting to find out more. As you progress through the story the gang's personalities really get a chance to shine with some of the, if not the best voice acting I've heard in a game. The dialog is very 'Until Dawn' like in that you only get a moment to choose from the dialog tree, which makes for a more honest response from the player. As with most games it's the not the main protagonist that creates an enjoyable experience but help from the supporting characters that really makes the experience feel complete. From the moment I started to the very end I thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of this game and highly recommend it.

This game takes everything you know about adventure games and throws it out the window. there is always a sense of urgency and tension in the back of your head as you play. DO THIS SPOILER FREE. your mind will be blown at the crazy amount of endings, and the replayablility of the game. my only issue is the movement system, as it can seem slow at times. This is a heavily speech focused game, and unlike telltale, your choices matter. speech is done so well that on every playthrough i attempt, i can get whole new conversations, or lack there of because you can play the whole thing without saying a word. 9/10 i got it on sale for 2 dollars, and was blown away by the quality of the game. im buying copies for all my friends! goodnight and goodluck!

Oxenfree is pretty well a combination of Life is Strange and the Goonies. The characters are well written and the story will grip you until the very end. The story can be altered by your actions/dialogue throughout the game allowing for a multitude of different character interactions and endings. There is very little not to like about this game as the soundtrack and voice acting is excellent and only add to the atmosphere of the game's beautiful art style.   Oxenfree is definitely worth a buy on sale -- try not to read too much on the story as it is generally best to go into these sorts of games not knowing anything!
I think I may have developed a genuine crush on Ren.

Bought the game from steam sale and I expected that it's going to be a mediocre game. Boy, I was wrong, it was quite on the contrary. What a amazing game. I'm on my second playthrough, I feel that this game also have a good replay value.

Oxenfree is an captivating and unique story with some fantastic voice acting. Choices matter, which is one of my favorite features in a game. I do wish it were a little longer (took me 5 hours) just because I was enjoying it so much, but the length felt right for the story. One suggestion... turn on subtitles. There are some heavily modulated voices that can be tough to understand without them at times.

An absolute blast. Not particularly horrifying, which might suck if you're a horror buf,f but it's awesome if you're like me and you just want some good old story. Not quite a Telltale epic, but it's in the same realm. Its characters especially are incredibly fun to get to know.

If you're not sure if you should buy this game then just imagine a normal story brings out a wrecking ball and smacks it over your head until you realise your not in front of your PC but in a hyperdimensional rift from which you have to escape or everything you know will be no more.  11/10 would story again    But seriously, this game has an amazing story which should definetly be explored and possibly discussed with others.

When cheesy 80's teenagers movie meets horror,I can't even say nothing more about this game.Plot twists, the tense moments are really make me thrilled and play for nearly half of the game in nearly a day. THIS GAME TOTALLY MY JAM!!! (My score:9.5/10 )

i love this game! it has beautiful music an artwork, and the characters and convrsations ar very realistic. the story is also really interesting, its very mystrious and even after playing the timeline about 5 times, theres still a lot of details that don't unrstand. my only complaint is that it can be a bit slow sometimes, but thats probably because my laptop is kinda slow.
