One of the best narrative games I've ever played. If you enjoy sci-fi, supernatural things and 80's-alike stories, you will enjoy Oxenfree.

I loved just about every aspect of this game. It's super stylish, with gorgeous art and music reminiscent of a late 80s teen horror film. The voice acting is great and the quick response system for the dialogue makes the conversations feel natural & the whole experience more immersive. So it looks, sounds, feels great, and the story it tells is top notch too.  Absolutely buy this game!

The characters in this game are so damn well written, the soundtrack, the mechanics tied into the radio, everything fits perfectly with the mistery. Great for those who love misteries and are into ARGs. I saw a man, but no dog.

Purchased on Humble Bundle and at the price it was, I would strongly recommend it. I thought that this game would be like a standard point and click but I was very impressed when what I got was a polished, Telltale-esque style game where you can move your character around the environment with the wasd keys and can interact with certain environment features. You can also chose what the main character can say which is really neat because you can form a character that relates to your personality. The music and voice acting is top notch, strikingly impressive for an indie game. The music is brilliant and fits this game perfectly. The atmosphere is dark and compelling and the story will pull you in with its mystery and eeriness. It features a game mechanic that is unlike something I've ever seen in a game before, where you can progress the story by tuning in to different frequencies on your portable radio. So far, I'm loving what I'm seeing, and there is enough collectibles and dialogue options to warrant another play through. I think the less you know about the game, the better because it will help keep the mystery and enhance your experience. A lot of people go into this game expecting a real 'game' but I would rather call it an experience. There is not enough content and maneuverability to really consider this a 'game', but there is enough lore, music, art, and even small choices to be considered more than a movie. And if you go into this game expecting quality that of a movie with minor choice and exploration elements, you will be far more likely to enjoy this experience, as it is one I highly recommend.  Update: Just beat the game at around ~4.8 hours of playtime, but man, that story was spectacular. It was an experience that I would recommend to just about anyone that has played and remotely liked any telltale game. You get to develop relationships with every character and what you say determines how the story will go. Another really cool feature this game has is a New Game+ mode, (SPOILERS AHEAD)   called 'Continue Timeline' in which you can restart the story and the moments in the story where you see your future self will be controlled by what choices you made in your previous play through. This could lead to further understanding of the game, and a really cool sense of déjà vu as you begin to make more connections the more times you play the game.   All in all, I loved this game and makes my top five list for games with similar mechanics. 9.5/10 because of a minor bug I encountered in the game where I can't move and minor audio glitches, but overall I highly recommend!

Great story, I wanted to continue playing it for hours. The characters were interesting. The puzzles weren't too in depth. The story did get slightly slow when you have to run back and forth to certain areas.

Eerie, unsettling, chock-full of atmosphere without resorting to jump scares.  The visuals are highly stylized but works very well, the audio and music adds immensely to the atmosphere, the story is rich, the voice acting is great, the characters engaging. All of your choices have branching consequences, and what you do in the beginning might come back to haunt you later on.  The one downside might be the €20 price tag for a game that takes about 4.5 hours to get through the first time, this is mitigated somewhat by decent replayability. Should you catch it on a sale it's definitely worth picking up!  All in all, this is a great game that I highly recommend.
Just whoa that's it.  It was worth it a must play.
The first time I played this game I thought it was pretty cool. Then I started my second playthrough, and it blew my mind.

Oxenfree is a game that combines the old teen horror flicks of the 80's with telltale-style storytelling through some of the most organic voice acting i've ever seen. With an art style that's straight out of a Coraline-style world, it doesn't disappoint with it's world building. There are multiple endings and replayability. Please check it out! I'd be doing you a disservice if I didn't recommend it.

I've never had a game mess me up the way this one did. You have to play it twice through for the full effect, maybe even a third time, but holy hell was it worth it. I was giggling I was so scared. But I say scared in the best possible way. I wasn't too scared to sleep scared, but adreniline pumping clutching my laptop, staying up until midnight when I have to be up at 4 am for work scared. I couldn't shut up about this game for weeks. In my head, I'm still thinking about it. My friends think I'm over it but little do they know.

So I am writing my first review for this game. Why you ask? Because its one of those 'games' that a simple thumps up or down doesn't do justice. So here is why as a game Oxenfree is bad. The game mechanics are nearly non existent and basically all you do is walk from A to B to B and back again. In between you choose the dialouges which then determine the relationship you have with the other characters. So that's it, you don't do much more expect switching the frequency on your radio which ends up pushing the direction mindlessly until you feel vibration in your controller. So much for the bad, but everything else is fantastic. The story is great and refreshing, the characters loveable and actually reasonable in how they react and what they do. Everything about this game from the artwork over the soundtrack to the story is amazingly done and has an incredible feeling. So that's a 9/10, maybe even more. However the game mechanincs in itself, since nearly non existing are just terrible 1/10. So if you are looking for an intriguing story with loveable characters and choices that kinda do matter then this game is for you. But if you play games, because you like to play and don't care much for story this game will just bore you to death. I had a great time though, an awesome game, but that's because I favour story above great gameplay. However it did leave me a bit unfulfilled at the end I feel like I missed out on some stuff, but is it enough for me to come back someday? Maybe, to change some choices and explore the story a bit more. Sadly when I think about it, I already dread the mindless 'press stick into the direction you wanna go' gamemechaning, because there just not much else there.  Anway, If I could I would give this both; a big thumps up for everything exept gameplay and a thumps down for exactly that. In the end this game was so refreshing I still have to give it a recommend even though there could be a lot more game in this title. I grabbed it for 5€ at the steamsale, I think I would mind having payed the full price though

I don't know what was about this game that mesmerized me. It gave me characters that I could actually understand and embellish. It gave me atmosphere. It gave indirect story telling and a drive to make you want to discover more about it.  Severely underated.
Great game, atomospheric and very good characters. Add to that the amazing soundtrack a great mechanic, and it's a must play. Saying anything more would spoil it... Just play it.

Incredible experience of 'what if I do this' games,  Really a great way to experience a design of games which emphasize dialogues as it's core mechanics, which also makes you think hard because it's leads to many consequences, just like in real life  Been a long time since I've played a game that makes me wants to play it again directly from beginning after completing it. I bought this game while it was on sale, and it is without a doubt the best thing I have purchased so far. It did not take long to complete the story, I finished it in less than 5 hours, but I have never been so attached to a story in a game before. Also, because choices matter, your character can develop different relationships to other characters, and can lead to different results. I will most likely play the game one more, maybe two more times to see all of the options that this game has to offer. I highly recommend this game, it has a great atmosphere, story, and characters that got me invested in the story which made me want to continue playing, and it kept me interested.

The game doesn't really have much to offer gameplay wise, but the writing is clever, the voice acting is good and the design is cool. One tip if you want to get the best possible endings - Pay attention. Read everything and remember every advice you're given.
Great story telling adventure horror game, much feels. ❤
A good game and rather interesting none to say the least. I loved the dialouge and how the characters are self-aware at times.

Whether 6 hours of gameplay is worth 20$ is up to you. I got it on sale for 10$ and spent a night playing through it with my SO and it was well worth it.

This game was probably my favorite game of 2016. Even though it is short, it took me about 2 hours to beat on my first try, the game has a lot of incentive to replay it. Whether it is the new game plus mode or just going for different endings. The story is phenomenal, and the characters are fantastic.
